IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To promote and encourage the use of electric energy and make it available (continued on Schedule O) to consumers at the lowest possible cost consistent with sound economy and good management.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To promote and encourage the use of electric energy and make it available to consumers at the lowest possible cost consistent with sound economy and good management.
IRS990.Desc: North Georgia EMC is a not-for-profit electric cooperative serving over 100,000 meters in Catoosa, Chattooga, Floyd, Gordon, Murray, Walker, and Whitfield counties.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Corporation is exempt from federal income taxes under Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(12). Pursuant to the Georgia Electric Cooperative Act, the Corporation is also exempt from state income taxes. Management has evaluated the Corporation's tax positions and concluded that the Corporation had taken no uncertain tax positions that require adjustment to the financial statements.
Other is made up of construction and retirement work in progress.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: North Georgia Electric Membership Foundation Inc

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: This donation is part of the CoBank Sharing Success Grant Match where CoBank will match the donation up to $10,000 to a charity of choice.
This donation is one time donation to the Chattanooga Area Food Bank to help with their mission of eliminating hunger by feeding, nourishing, and empowering those they serve.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Grant funds go through an invoice approval process.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NGEMC is a member owned electric cooperative.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors is elected by the members of NGEMC through a democratic process.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Cooperative members must approve any disposition of all or substantialy all assets.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NGEMC's Board of Directors will review the Form 990 before submitting it to the Internal Revenue Service.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board members and employees are required to disclose annually anything that is considered to be a conflict of interest as defined by NGEMC's conflict of interest policy.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The CEO's compensation is approved by the Board of Directors yearly. The board also approves the compensation for management on a yearly basis.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NGEMC will provide its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements to the public upon request.
Changes in Membership 6,940. Postretirement Benefit Liability Adjustment 277,244. Margins Assigned/Assignable to Members 411,513.
